result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael T. Lee was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: 10:21 AM Defendant Michael T. Lee in court.  Attorney Richard Russell McCue Jr in court for Michael T. Lee.  Attorney Cheniqua White in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant pleads no contest to counts 2, 3, and 4. Court finds the defendant guilty on counts 2, 3, and 4. Count 1 is dismissed and read in. Court orders sentence withheld 1 year probation on each count. As a condition of probation, defendant must complete a domestic violence intervention program. Costs due within 60 days. Sentence credit 2.
